com.mostc.pftt.model.custom
Class NTFSACL

java.lang.Object
  com.mostc.pftt.model.custom.NTFSACL

public class NTFSACL
extends java.lang.Object

Represents an Access-Control-List (ACL), specifically an ACL for the NTFS File system. Can generate all valid permutations of ACLs for functional testing on NTFS. Based on ACL-Test (JScript) written by Ryan Biesemeyer. NOTE: this class doesn't use PHP to set or check ACLs at all. Rather it sets up the ACLs so that a test case can then use PHP to check them.

Author:
Matt Ficken, Ryan Biesemeyer

public void permute(Host host,
                    NTFSACL.EReductionMode reduction,

permute

public void permute(Host host,
                    NTFSACL.EReductionMode reduction,
                    java.lang.String directory_root,
                    NTFSACL.IPermutationCallback callback_function,
                    java.lang.Object callback_arguments,
                    boolean do_setup,
                    java.io.PrintWriter log_pw)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Run a callback function for every selected permutation.

Parameters:
host -
reduction - - reducing out certain knon-cancelling permutations.
directory_root - - where you want the ACL structure to be built
callback_function -
callback_arguments - - passed unmodified to callback_function as optional_params
do_setup - - setup the ACL
log_pw - - log output
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
